cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles ENE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-southwest toward the northwest Bahamas, then westward to make landfall on the southeast Florida coast late Wednesday night or early Thursday, crossing the Florida peninsula, emerging near the northeast Gulf/Big Bend area, and turning north-northeast through Georgia and the Carolinas into the Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast coast of Florida (Boca Raton â€“ Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is in effect from south of Hallandale Beach FL around the Florida Keys and along the west coast to the Ochlockonee River FL.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Boca Raton FL to Flagler/Volusia County line FL; Tropical Storm Warning Hallandale Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA and NW Bahamas; Storm Surge Warning North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA, including St. Johns River.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas, entire Florida east coast, Florida peninsula, Big Bend, southeast Georgia, South Carolina, and eventually Mid-Atlantic/New England coasts.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is only about 3%, with peak winds under 34 kt expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; Mobile Bay lies well west of the surge watch area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible Friday as the system passes east of the port, totals generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very low risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; operational impacts expected to be minor.
